segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: To recover a corrupted drive that has been protected by BitLocker, a Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) help desk user must create a recovery key package file.
segment.target: To recover a corrupted drive that has been protected by BitLocker, a Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) help desk user must create a recovery key package file.

segment.source: This package file can be copied to the computer that contains the corrupted drive and then used to recover the drive.
segment.target: This package file can be copied to the computer that contains the corrupted drive and then used to recover the drive.

segment.source: To accomplish this, use the following procedure.
segment.target: To accomplish this, use the following procedure.

segment.source: To Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: To Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: Open the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: Open the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: Select Drive Recovery from the navigation pane.
segment.target: Select Drive Recovery from the navigation pane.

segment.source: Enter the user’s domain name and user name, the reason for unlocking the drive, and the user’s recovery password ID.
segment.target: Enter the user’s domain name and user name, the reason for unlocking the drive, and the user’s recovery password ID.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are a member of the Help Desk Administrators role, you do not have to enter the user’s domain name or user name.
segment.target: If you are a member of the Help Desk Administrators role, you do not have to enter the user’s domain name or user name.

segment.source: Click Submit.
segment.target: Click Submit.

segment.source: The recovery key will be displayed.
segment.target: The recovery key will be displayed.

segment.source: Click Save, and then select Recovery Key Package.
segment.target: Click Save, and then select Recovery Key Package.

segment.source: The recovery key package will be created on your computer.
segment.target: The recovery key package will be created on your computer.

segment.source: Copy the recovery key package to the computer that has the corrupted drive.
segment.target: Copy the recovery key package to the computer that has the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Open an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: Open an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: To do this, click Start and type in the Search programs and files box.
segment.target: To do this, click Start and type in the Search programs and files box.

segment.source: In the search results list, right-click cmd.exe and select Run as Administrator.
segment.target: In the search results list, right-click cmd.exe and select Run as Administrator.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For the fixed drive in the command, specify an available storage device that has free space equal to or larger than the data on the corrupted drive.
segment.target: For the fixed drive in the command, specify an available storage device that has free space equal to or larger than the data on the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Data on the corrupted drive is recovered and moved to the specified fixed drive.
segment.target: Data on the corrupted drive is recovered and moved to the specified fixed drive.
